pages.text: No one will roast in it, except the most wretched
The one who denied (the truth), and turned away
Far removed from it, would be the righteous one
The one who sought to purify ( his soul), and spent his wealth (in charity)
Not because he had any favors to return
But because he sought the pleasure of his Lord, the most High
(Such a man) would certainly be well pleased
(I swear) by the morning light
And the night, as it becomes calm
(Oh Muhammad, SAW), your Lord has not forsaken you; He is not displeased
The life to come is better for you than the earlier life
Soon, your Lord will grant you (His blessings); you shall be well-pleased
Did He not find you an orphan, and gave you shelter
He found you unguided, and guided you
Found you poor, and enriched you
So do not oppress the orphan
And do not (angrily) repulse (and rebuff) the needy, the beggar
(Rather), proclaim the favors of your Lord
(Oh Muhammad, SAW), did We not lay your chest open (and responsive to the truth)
And We lightened your burden
That bore so heavy on your back
And We raised your prestige (in the world)
The fact is: along with hardship, there is ease
No doubt, along with hardship there is ease
So, when you are done (with your daily chores), attend
And strive to please your Lord
